sect3.title: moc-files not found
sect3.para: Question: For the GUI project I didn’t find files such as "moc_GUIApplicationWindow.cpp" (there are seven files beginning with “moc_” ). If I delete them, I have some link errors like : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol "protected: virtual void __thiscall GUIApplicationWindow::initMetaObject(void)" (?initMetaObject@GUIApplicationWindow@@MAEXXZ)
Do you have any suggestions to resolve this problem ?

Answer: Yes, those files are used by the Qt-library (www.troll-tech.com) and are build automatically. If you take a look into the project settings (MSVC++: project->settings->gui) and open the file browser within this window, some .h-files have another icon. If you click on one of these and choose the "user defined building" (I do not exactly know how it is called in english), you will see some additional program calls.

To build the gui, you have to install Qt2.3 which includes some additional programs within a bin-folder, automatically installed. Set the environment variable "QTDIR" to the folder you have installed Qt into (not to the bin-folder as you may see from the calls within the project). This should let MSVC++ build the moc*-files first.
